alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 27 at 12:18AM CST until February 27 at 1:00AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Cherokee County in southeastern Kansas... Newton County in southwestern Missouri... McDonald County in southwestern Missouri... Southern Jasper County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 100 AM CST. * At 1218 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Chetopa to near Bernice State Park to near Proctor, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Joplin, Carthage, Neosho, Webb City, Big Sugar Creek State Park, Carl Junction, Baxter Springs, Galena, Oronogo, Seneca, Granby, Anderson, Carterville, Noel, Duquesne, Dodge, Sarcoxie, Goodman, Duenweg and South West City. This includes the following highways... Interstate 44 between mile markers 0 and 31. Interstate 49 between mile markers 1 and 46. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
